intro: Bourreria velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
